edu.luc.etl.cs313.android.shapes.android

Class Draw

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.luc.etl.cs313.android.shapes.android.Draw
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Visitor<java.lang.Void>

    public class Draw
extends java.lang.Object
implements Visitor<java.lang.Void>
    A Visitor for drawing a shape to an Android canvas.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas, android.graphics.Paint paint) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Void onCircle(Circle c)
      onCircle is a visitor that sets the draw action of the canvas at the top left of the canvas and paints a circle from the radius of the circle object.
      java.lang.Void onFill(Fill f)
      onFill first saves the canvas paint style to saveStyle, then sets both the stroke color and the color fill for the canvas to the values stored within the onFill object.
      java.lang.Void onGroup(Group g)
      onGroup draws each shape within it by redirecting method calls to their respective visitor or decorator within Draw Each type of Shape is then handled by its own method to outsource the correct functionality This in turn works for groups within groups as a form of recursion
      java.lang.Void onLocation(Location l)
      onLocation draws a "Location" which entails translating position on the canvas and drawing the shape encased inside The positional move is taken based on the state of the Location, and the shape is drawn by the respective visitor function.
      java.lang.Void onOutline(Outline o)
      onOutline draws an Outlined figure on the canvas.
      java.lang.Void onPolygon(Polygon s)
      onPolygon is a visitor that takes a polygon shape and builds a list of lines to be drawn by taking the points from the polygon shape list and adding them to an int array that is then sent to to the canvas via the drawLines method.
      java.lang.Void onRectangle(Rectangle r)
      onRectangle is a visitor that sets the draw action of the canvas at the top left of the canvas and paints a rectangle from the height and width of the rectangle object.
      java.lang.Void onStrokeColor(StrokeColor c)
      onStrokeColor is a visitor that saves the paint color of the canvas before setting the paint color to that set as the color in the StrokeColor decorater object, calling accept on the shape wrapped in the StrokeColor object, and then setting the canvas color back to the original color, stored in saveColor.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • onCircle

        public java.lang.Void onCircle(Circle c)
        onCircle is a visitor that sets the draw action of the canvas at the top left of the canvas and paints a circle from the radius of the circle object.
        Specified by:
        onCircle in interface Visitor<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        c - circle object to be drawn
        Returns:
        null

      • onStrokeColor

        public java.lang.Void onStrokeColor(StrokeColor c)
        onStrokeColor is a visitor that saves the paint color of the canvas before setting the paint color to that set as the color in the StrokeColor decorater object, calling accept on the shape wrapped in the StrokeColor object, and then setting the canvas color back to the original color, stored in saveColor. This ensures that all the shapes wrapped in this stroke color are drawn in the specified color, while the canvas still remembers the color used before this object was drawn.
        Specified by:
        onStrokeColor in interface Visitor<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        c - strokeColor object to be unwrapped and drawn
        Returns:
        null

      • onFill

        public java.lang.Void onFill(Fill f)
        onFill first saves the canvas paint style to saveStyle, then sets both the stroke color and the color fill for the canvas to the values stored within the onFill object. The shapes within the onFill object are then unwrapped and drawn via the accept method. Finally, the canvas fill and stroke style are returned to the saveStyle state.
        Specified by:
        onFill in interface Visitor<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        f - onFill object to be unwrapped and drawn
        Returns:
        null

      • onGroup

        public java.lang.Void onGroup(Group g)
        onGroup draws each shape within it by redirecting method calls to their respective visitor or decorator within Draw Each type of Shape is then handled by its own method to outsource the correct functionality This in turn works for groups within groups as a form of recursion
        Specified by:
        onGroup in interface Visitor<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        g - is the group
        Returns:
        null

      • onLocation

        public java.lang.Void onLocation(Location l)
        onLocation draws a "Location" which entails translating position on the canvas and drawing the shape encased inside The positional move is taken based on the state of the Location, and the shape is drawn by the respective visitor function. The position on the canvas is then returned to the original place.
        Specified by:
        onLocation in interface Visitor<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        l - the location
        Returns:
        null

      • onRectangle

        public java.lang.Void onRectangle(Rectangle r)
        onRectangle is a visitor that sets the draw action of the canvas at the top left of the canvas and paints a rectangle from the height and width of the rectangle object.
        Specified by:
        onRectangle in interface Visitor<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        r - rectangle to be drawn
        Returns:
        null

      • onOutline

        public java.lang.Void onOutline(Outline o)
        onOutline draws an Outlined figure on the canvas. First, this method saves the current Style set up. Then, we convert it to an outline, draw the shape by visiting the appropriate method, and then reset the Style to the original state.
        Specified by:
        onOutline in interface Visitor<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        o - the Outline
        Returns:
        null

      • onPolygon

        public java.lang.Void onPolygon(Polygon s)
        onPolygon is a visitor that takes a polygon shape and builds a list of lines to be drawn by taking the points from the polygon shape list and adding them to an int array that is then sent to to the canvas via the drawLines method. The list of points to be drawn has the first point connecting to the last point so as to close the polygon shape
        Specified by:
        onPolygon in interface Visitor<java.lang.Void>
        Parameters:
        s - polygon shape to be drawn
        Returns:
        null
